title: Book or manage a free NHS flu vaccination at a pharmacy
description: Find out how to book an NHS flu vaccination appointment online.
cleaned_text: Use this service to book an appointment for a free flu vaccine at a pharmacy. Who can use this service You can book a flu vaccine online if you're registered with a GP surgery in England. You can [register with a GP](https://www.nhs.uk/nhs-services/gps/how-to-register-with-a-gp-surgery/) if you do not have one. Important: This service is paused The 2022/23 flu vaccination season has closed, and NHS flu vaccines are no longer available. Further information will be provided later this year regarding booking a flu vaccination for the 2023/24 flu season. People aged 65 and over If you're aged 65 years old or over (including if you'll be 65 years old by 31 March 2024), you can book a free flu vaccine online. People aged 18 to 64 If you're aged 18 to 64 years old, you can book a free flu vaccine online if you: - have certain long-term health conditions - are pregnant - are in long-stay residential care - receive a carer's allowance, or are the main carer for an older or disabled person who may be at risk if you get sick - live with someone who is more likely to get a severe infection (such as someone who has HIV, has had a transplant, or is having certain treatments for cancer, lupus or rheumatoid arthritis) - are a frontline worker in a social care setting (if you cannot get a flu vaccine through your employer) Page last reviewed: 9 August 2023 Next review
